WRITING.TITLE: YSK why it's important to tell your child care provider they are being filmed.
WRITING.TEXT: Not only is it just polite to tell someone they are being watched for hours on end in your home, it's safer for your child. Do not wait until the nanny/baby sitter messes up to let them know they are on camera. You are not being sneaky by not telling them. We all know how much we try to get away with when no one is looking. Your child is worth more than that!
That's always a thing. I just recommend background checks and trying your hardest to trust your gut about something like that

It could be safer because the adult watching the child is aware they're being watched. If they were not aware they're being watch you run the risk of them doing something they wouldnt have done if they knew they were being watched.
You get use to it. A lot of times its just basic security and not really to watch the nanny. It should be a law if it isn't. It's kinda creepy to NOT tell someone..

However once you are comfortable in a home you can easily forget you are being watched. You're not disclosing passwords. You are telling a guest in your home you are watching them. If your child care provider is aggressive and you see them hurting your child on the camera yes you can address that. However, they might have thought twice about hurting them if they knew they were being watched. You don't want to wait for them to hurt your kid before you let them know there's cameras. Cameras might actually protect your kid. Any parent can tell you it's not hard to mess up picking your kid up, raising your voice, etc. Kids suck a lot of times and some people aren't built to care for them.

I was under the impression some states in America acknowledge indigenous people day. Ohio doesn't. I'm not saying they're celebrating slavery. I'm saying celebrating slave owners is horrible. They shouldn't be on our money, they shouldn't have holidays, and they should always be talked about in the proper light. If you owned people to do things for you, I don't care if you represented a new democracy. That democracy was only for a very small group of people. All the brown people on that land. No freedoms, had no vote in any matter, and definitely get ignored on President's Day. Which is during Black History Month. Talk about a slap in the face

I still think if you owned people, raped, or a pedophile, anything good you do should go out the door. Those cancel everything out. I'm okay with canceling all of those people. I understand taking the good with the bad. But I think if people are still suffering from the aftermath of slavery, you should probably do what you can to make it right. And creating holidays and putting their faces on money isn't one of them. I think people should think about George Washington owning slaves. If you don't want to repeat history why sugarcoat it? I'm sure if you went back in time and asked those slaves if they wanted art or their freedom, they're going to choose freedom. I understand everything happens for a reason, or the significance of bad things that include things in motion. But I don't think we're doing anyone any Justice by having a George Washington day, or having any slave owners being glorified in any way possible.

I got you: Seek support from loved ones and try to access resources that can better serve your mental health. If you don't have much money and a bundle of illness (like myself) state programs exist and depending on where you are from they are helpful. If you aren't getting the help you need please keep trying to find the right doctors for you! Took me 4 years to find a good counselor. Do not be afraid of medication. If it's not working out you might need something else. Or a lower dose and more/different therapy. It is not easy to rid yourself of depression. Solutions are hard but if you're tired of being depressed you and only you can change that. As a person whose had a long history with mental health and abuse: I do not accept not trying as a reason to coddle you. Ignorance and lack of resources is one thing. But to say "I'm depressed and I'm not going to do anything about it ever" is literally crazy. Obvi from case to case this changes. If you are so sad you cannot bathe and dress yourself every day and you get bullied for it, you need serious help. Lack of hygiene is a symptom of depression. People have to be around you and you stink. They will react. That is life. Take a shower before you leave the house or dont! We've all been there but we're all not using it as an excuse. No matter how nice it would be, no one is bending for your illness. You learn to cope, not the other way around.

I agree. However, sometimes the solution is simple but getting to it is hard. I think you missed where i said I suffer from a mental illness. I literally said go to a doctor and find the right treatment. I am not a doctor but am training in the mental health field. Being aware is one thing but it's another to expect people to change for YOU. YOU need to change. YOU need to learn to cope. We can only ask the public to be aware and be patient. If you are doing nothing you cannot expect people to baby you. You have the right to be ill and not seek treatment but no one is allowed to judge you for it? That's not fair. Take care of yoself and put some effort into it and people will be more willing to be understanding. You don't wake up and be better. It takes YEARS and practice. I'm still going to therapy and have meds I will take until i die. It's my responsibility to take care of myself for the sake of my family and the public.

WRITING.TITLE: YSK: Not to excuse your teen's emotions because they're "hormonal."
WRITING.TEXT: We as parents, are not doctors. We are only guessing that the hormones are running wild that day and that's what wrong. We cannot look into out child's brain and say "ah yes, testosterone is up there today." Hormones suck, us women know this first hand. However, assuming it's hormones is a great way to ignore the bigger picture. Middle school and high school seem so long ago, so we forgot about all the drama and bullying and simple bs teenage angst that was there. Girls are getting fatter while the boys thin out and get taller. Girls get a littler meaner, a little more self conscious. Boys start to smell, get self concious, start thinking about dating, etc. Those concerns are real and impact their lives. If you woke up every day feeling fat, like no one likes you, school is hard, you would be emotional too. Some mental illnesses develop in early teen and young adult years. Don't ignore signs of illness because they're going through puberty. Try to talk to your children and even consider a therapist/mentor to help guide them through the rough patch. Yes, hormones are a factor but don't make up as much of the problem as you think. It's easy to ignore them and say they'll get over it. But ask yourself, is that what YOU needed at this time?

Hello. I want to start off by saying you're not alone. I have said everything you've told me and my wife is going through something similar now. It seems like you need a different therapist. Sometimes talking or help in general isn't the help you want, but it's the help you need. Sometimes we have to feel our feelings, figure them out, and THEN deal with them. I'm sorry about your cat. The stages of grief aren't linear. You're going to feel lots of things at different times. Meditation is scientifically proven to help with anxiety. You seem anxious. Meditation is it causing you to relive bad events, that's PTSD. Your brain is so overworked Will trauma you can't even take a moment to yourself. I think you could benefit from EMDR therapy. Talk to your therapist about it. The second to last paragraph reminds me of myself before I found out I had bipolar disorder. I would recommend talking to a doctor about being screened for a mental illness. And sometimes we lash out because we don't know how else to communicate was going on within ourselves. And therapy is supposed to help with that too. Depending on your age and where you live now how controlling your mom is, you have more control over your health than what you think. At any time you have a private moment with your doctor please take advantage of it and tell them the truth about your situation and let them help you. You can even tell them that you want a new doctor oh, no offense, and your mother isn't helping you find one. Our doctors, counselors, social workers, therapists are supposed to advocate for us. That is their jobs. If they are not advocating for you they are not doing their jobs.

Therapy helped me with these concerns. Talking it out, and hearing what your going through is normal makes for a peace of mind. I promise. It seems like you have symptoms of depression. Often when I'm depressed I don't have interest in things I usually do, or lose motivation to try new things. Practicing mindfulness will be helpful. To not care about what people think, this is what I do: I tell myself its none of buisness what goes on in someone's mind, and I evaluate how their judgment affects me, my family, and my future. Most of the time, it doesn't. Your taste in music doesn't change any of that. Someone doesn't like it? Okay, cool. I don't like a lot of shit either lol. People judge, we're wired to do it. You have to accept that. You may be doing to much at once. Routine is helpful. Try one new thing for 6 weeks, make it routine, and start something else after. Example: you want abs AND want to start jogging. First six weeks you get into a routine of 25 sit ups after breakfast. That's what you do for 6 weeks or until it's normal for you. After that, work on jogging. My best motivation is to just do it. I know it sounds dumb, but just do it. You'll whine, complain, but once it's over you'll feel better. Kinda like going to work. You rather play video games but you need a pay Check. You rather play video games, but your mental health needs you more than you need video games at that moment.

When they call asking for payment I say "sure! I want an itemized bill first." Usually they ask for my address and MAYBE actually send it. Nope. I'm saying if they send the receipt , and it's not from the hospital, they're violating HIPAA. You're not responsible for paying for it if they violate your rights. If the collections agency can't get to the hospital to send you to an itemized receipt, and you tell them you won't pay without it, sometimes they let it go. I know this from personal experience. Take all advice you get from the internet with a grain of salt. Also look into that book, I'm pretty sure it goes more in depth about it.

Also, and itemized receipt could cause problems for them. You could get that receipt and see that they want you to pay for services you didn't receive. I'm assuming it's easier to let that go and pursue people who will pay then keep wasting their time on someone who wants to fight it.
I can only speak from my personal experience. It worked for me.

Hey! It's also good to see what you're paying for. No one is perfect. Just like at a restaurant, sometimes you get rung up for something you didn't get. Sometimes people get charged for an x-ray they didn't receive. It's good to know that before you pay for it. Some people can not pay their bills. Some people have diseases that require them to be at the hospital more than they like to, and therefore accumulate more bills and they can afford. And they usually can't work. Social Security is really hard to get, and Medicaid doesn't pay for everything. I can argue that other countries have this figured out and people aren't drounding in debt, but I think that's common sense at this point. Try to have more compassion for people who are poor.

Under HIPPAA you have the right to protect the privacy of your medical records from third parties. If you didn't give the hospital permission to send the the receipt to you, and the credit bureau did, that's a problem. You may then ask them to provide proof WITH your signature saying you wanted that relased, as that is the only way to do it under HIPPA. Page 119 of the book has the sample letter with more details.
Hey! I would look at that manual. It's a little more complicated than that. You're not asking the hospital for the bill. You are asking collections.

Garnishments sucks. I advise everyone to read the manual, and make their own decisions before doing anything serious. You're not ignoring or avoiding. You are challenging a shitty system. And at the least, making sure you're not being overcharged.

WRITING.TITLE: Most parents are trying their best and don't mean to embarrass/dissapoint/traumatize you.
WRITING.TEXT: Every day I see people pointing out how every little thing a parent does is so horrible. From an embarrassing prank all the way to "my dad didn't cry when I gave him his birthday card. ASSHOLE!" I don't think most people (at least on reddit) understand parents aren't being malicious. Intent SHOULD make a difference. Parents (decent ones) are just trying their best. They're not perfect. They're going to traumatize you one way or another. They're going to do things you don't like. They're raising you from birth to 18+. You spend every. single. day. with them for YEARS. You're not going to like them, and they're not going to like you either sometimes. You suck too. Think about your worst day, and then ask your parents about their worst day with YOU. As a parent, kids get super annoying. Even the most well behaved kids. Parents are still human beings with their own wants and needs who then have to raise you to be a decent human in a crazy world. It's not easy. It gets very overwhelming and frustrating. I remember my mom snapping at me every time I asked her to buy me something. I hated it. I hated her. Why can't she just fucking buy it?! It's because this bitch was struggling to keep the lights on. She's not worried about me having my own laptop for MySpace. We want our parents to be perfect and sweet and kind 24/7. They can't just like we can't. Go to therapy. Talk to your parents. Be as understanding as you want them to be for you. I'm not excusing bad parenting. If you have an abusive or neglectful parent, I truly feel for you and this is NOT about you.

Supervisor is important. There are a ton of apps and programs to help monitor your kid. My son can't even download an app without my approval lol. If the child is between two homes, it's really convenient. I do think kids can wait for iPhones and stuff like that. Some families work better when the kids have phones.
Maybe if they used something else. BMI SUCKS and doesn't account for anything else. Thin waist but huge boobs and ass? OBESE. Like no.
I'm 6ft and could never be 149. 200 would be pretty skinny for me.
I'm sorry to hear this, but I'm glad you have some memories to look back on and appreciate. Stay safe.
Absolutely! No one is perfect. Because you pop a kid out doesn't just magically make you all knowing and perfect.

I'm not surprised. I grew up neglected and abused and my peers did too (Low SES neighborhoods). I'm surprised at how some consider non abusive actions as abusive or bad parenting. My wife's family is more abusive than mine in some ways, so she also had a sad time realizing things can be better. My mom actually turned around and is a better mom and a wonderful grandmother. There's hope lol. There's a difference between "this isn't right" and straight up abuse. We might not always see it ourselves but it's there. People, especially kids, often feel entitled to their parents everything. From attention all the way to money. Some people don't get it and think its abuse or "not right." And even if some things aren't right, the parents are still people. I think some Redditors forget that. "Mom shouldn't have had an attitude but mom is a single parent with 4 boys who won't put the seat down after begging them to for years." It's like we don't consider what the parent is going through at all. No one considers that maybe that poster is a shit kid whose parents are just over it. Obvi we shouldn't victim blame. But let me tell you...kids suck and aren't always innocent.

Hi, poor person here. It's not that simple. Especially if you are apart of a family who grew up poor, on meat. I can buy 3 lbs of meat, divide it, freeze it, and use it time and time again and my family will be full every time. Yes, we can figure something else out. Can you imagine that pressure? Yeah we're smarter but we haven't always been and that's why we have meat. We can NOW but we couldn't before. Now you have to show the world we're not caveman and have other shit to eat. You don't have to wear a bra. My back has never been happier. I don't worry about sagging at all, because it's going to happen one way or the other. Some chest exercises will help if you're really worried about it. But if you hate wearing bras, you really don't have to wear one. I encourage all women to go one week without wearing a bra.
